topic.title: [Alpha] Nodis Chatroom for zeronet.
topic.body:
I have been working on this easy to use and beautiful chatroom for zeronet called Nodis Chat and would like to share it with you all. Note that this is a very alpha version and some things might not work properly or work at all.

What I've been able to achieve so far is a general chatroom that you can use to chat with others. Some features I plan on adding includes: secure(crypto) private messaging, contacts lists, eventually turning the chatroom into a merger sites with different hubs for different topics or private/personal hubs(so group chats essentially). And of course a dark mode.

Things like image, emoji, or file upload support could be added in the far future but as of right now they are not too much of a priority. So just go to the link, try stuff out, give me some feedback and tell me what to think. I'll eventually add the source code on github/gitlab/gitcenter once I get a good base version of the chatroom but until then I'll be sole developer.

Email me at zeromail: akalai@zeroid.bit
Nodis Chat: http://127.0.0.1:43110/17Co5QuvXCG2oVG5vE6gpKacC2HQYx64Vr/

ProtonVPN is good. They are fast(generally), allows pay in Bitcoin, has a free option available, etc.. If you are doing risky stuff you can't go wrong with protonvpn->tor->clearnet/darknet

> [otoruk](#comment_9_1MhLCR913AyW8chNJDGqVQEDitX8AE5PZ6): Mullvad, maybe. Stay the hell away from ProtonVPN, NordVPN, Hola VPN [...]

Interesting... I chose ProtonVPN from this list by the way: https://www.privacytools.io/providers/vpn/

But there are contradictions to the article you provided..This for instance: https://twitter.com/conspirator0/status/1036353291662360577

Also, you shouldn't put all your trust in VPNs. They are supposed to give a little more privacy than your ISP but you should always use https and always encrypt. Doing anything illegal using just a VPN is stupid and makes you a low hanging fruit.
